alert.note: Alert for Labette; Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 7:44PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Labette and Montgomery Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Havana, or 8 miles northeast of Caney, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Cherryvale, Caney, Altamont, Dearing, Mound Valley, Tyro, Liberty, Havana, Bolton, Sycamore, Parsons Tri City Airport, Angola, Dennis, Elk City Lake, Big Hill Lake, Elk City State Park, Independence Airport and Coffeyville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
